flawed_nl_solution:
John has made $250 in 10 days, so this means he makes $250/10=<<250/10=25>>25 dollars a day.
Since John wants to make double his current amount, this means he wants to make 250*2=<<250*2=5000>>5000 dollars
This means John needs to work 5000/25= <<5000/25=200>>200 days in total to make 5000.
As John has already worked 10 days, this means he needs to work 200-10=<<200-10=190>>190 more days to make his goal.
#### 190

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 500, not 5000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
